title: Nicola Peltz looks sensational in white minidress at Golden Globes afterparty
title_page: Nicola Peltz looks sensational in white minidress at Golden Globes afterparty | Daily Mail Online
text:
Despite being lesser established in acting circles, she has certainly made an impact on gossip columns.
Nicola Peltz looked sensational in a plunging white mini-dress as she hit the red carpet at the InStyle and Warner Bros. Golden Globes after-party at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles.
The 20-year-old actress narrowly avoided a potentially awkward run-in with fellow starlet Bella Thorne, who mysteriously branded an unnamed celebrity a 'Hollywood mean girl' last year - with many claiming Nicola was the star in question.
Scroll down for video
Sultry: Nicola Peltz looked sensational in a plunging white mini-dress as she hit the red carpet at the InStyle and Warner Bros. Golden Globes after-party at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles
Nicola, who was joined by her actor brother Will, went for a simplistic yet high fashion look in a chic white mini-dress with both a high-hem and plunging neckline.
While showing off a mass of cleavage in the look, the dress boasted a unique black choker detail which matched the black accents framing the bust and hips.
She added height to her slender frame with sky-high black heels with an ankle strap and sported no further accessories to allow for a clean, futuristic look.
The New York-native, whose father is billionaire businessman Nelson Feltz, wore her blonde locks in loose natural waves and sported a thick outline of liquid eyeliner, a dewy dab of foundation and matte taupe lipstick.
Watch out: The 20-year-old actress narrowly avoided a potentially awkward run-in with fellow starlet Bella Thorne, who mysteriously branded an unnamed celebrity a 'Hollywood mean girl' last year - with many claiming Nicola was the star in question
Sashaying along the red carpet shortly before her was striking star Bella, who looked sensational in a shimmering gown designed by Julien Macdonald.
Despite each being movers-and-shakers in Hollywood young starlets circles, a red carpet collision could have been disastrous for the girls due to reverberating rumours.
In November last year, Bella made illusive comments about a mystery 'Hollywood mean girl' during an interview with Seventeen magazine, saying that the star is 'very, very mean', adding: 'I never say hello to her.'
'Her siblings are not mean like she is. It’s just her,' she said, 'One of the reasons I don’t like her is because she’s been a billionaire since she was very little, and she’s never had to work for anything in her life.'
Who's the mean girl? Sashaying along the red carpet shortly before her was striking star Bella, who looked sensational in a shimmering gown designed by Julien Macdonald
While a host of stars were called into question through a process of illimination, including Bella and Gigi Hadid, Ariana Grande, Kylie and Kendall Jenner and Miley Cyrus, many believe Nicola is the culprit.
Nicola, who has appeared in films such as Transformers: Age of Extinction and on the A&E series Bates Motel, meets the criteria for Bella's mystery 'mean girl'.
Not only was she born to an actual billionaire, but also has plenty of siblings including actor Will and hockey player, Brad Peltz, and also has a seriously bad reputation for being a diva.
In 2009, an article by Gawker about the dramas that existed behind closed doors at the Peltz's family home singled out the 'youngest daughter' who 'routinely threatens maids that she will have her father fire them if they don't do as she asks'.
